TITLE: Installing PySAL from Conda-Forge
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install PySAL from the conda-forge channel using Anaconda. First adds the conda-forge channel to the configuration, then installs the pysal package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda config --add channels conda-forge
conda install pysal
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PySAL meta-package using pip
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the complete PySAL ecosystem using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install pysal
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PySAL using pip
DESCRIPTION: Command to install PySAL using pip package manager. This is an alternative installation method to using Anaconda.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install pysal
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PySAL meta-package using conda
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the complete PySAL ecosystem using conda package manager from the conda-forge channel.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda install --channel conda-forge pysal
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing individual PySAL packages using pip
DESCRIPTION: Example command to install specific PySAL packages (esda and mapclassify) using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install esda mapclassify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing individual PySAL packages using conda
DESCRIPTION: Example command to install specific PySAL packages (esda and mapclassify) using conda package manager from the conda-forge channel.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda install --channel conda-forge esda mapclassify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PySAL development version from GitHub
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the latest development version of PySAL directly from the GitHub repository using pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install git+https://github.com/pysal/pysal.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Geometric Functions Index in PySAL's CG Module
DESCRIPTION: Index mapping of various computational geometry functions in libpysal.cg including angle calculations, bounding box operations, distance measurements, intersection tests, and grid management utilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/libpysal-inv.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
libpysal.cg.get_angle_between
libpysal.cg.get_bounding_box
libpysal.cg.get_point_at_angle_and_dist
libpysal.cg.get_points_dist
libpysal.cg.get_polygon_point_dist
libpysal.cg.get_polygon_point_intersect
libpysal.cg.get_ray_segment_intersect
libpysal.cg.get_rectangle_point_intersect
libpysal.cg.get_rectangle_rectangle_intersection
libpysal.cg.get_segment_point_dist
libpysal.cg.get_segment_point_intersect
libpysal.cg.get_segments_intersect
libpysal.cg.get_shared_segments
libpysal.cg.Grid
libpysal.cg.harcdist
libpysal.cg.is_clockwise
libpysal.cg.is_collinear
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Citing PySAL in Scientific Publications
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides the BibTeX entry for citing PySAL in scientific publications. It references the paper 'PySAL: A Python Library of Spatial Analytical Methods' by Rey and Anselin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/index.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bibtex
CODE:
```
@Article{pysal2007,
  author={Rey, Sergio J. and Anselin, Luc},
  title={{PySAL: A Python Library of Spatial Analytical Methods}},
  journal={The Review of Regional Studies},
  year=2007,
  volume={37},
  number={1},
  pages={5-27},
  keywords={Open Source; Software; Spatial}
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Executing Changelog Generation Process
DESCRIPTION: Commands to generate the changelog for a new PySAL release. The main 'make' command runs all steps automatically, while individual commands are provided for debugging specific parts of the process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/tools/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Git Commands for Releasing PySAL
DESCRIPTION: Git commands for committing changes to the meta package configuration, creating a version tag, and pushing the release to the upstream repository.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/tools/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git add ../pyproject.toml
git add release.yaml
git commit -m "REL: <version>"
git tag <version>
git push upstream <version>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Specific Changelog Generation Steps
DESCRIPTION: Individual make commands for different stages of the changelog generation process. These commands help with debugging by focusing on specific parts of the build process.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/tools/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
make frozen
make gitcount
make changelog
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PySAL v1.14.3 for Python 2 compatibility
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the older version 1.14.3 of PySAL which is compatible with Python 2, using conda. This is for users who need Python 2 compatibility.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
conda install pysal==1.14.3
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing legacy PySAL version for Python 2 support
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the last PySAL version (1.14.4.post2) that supports Python 2 using pip.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/installation.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install pysal==1.14.4.post2
```

TITLE: Including Bibliography in RST Documentation
DESCRIPTION: Directive for including bibliography citations from a BibTeX file located in _static/references.bib. The :cited: flag ensures only cited references are included in the output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/pysal/pysal/blob/main/docs/references.rst#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: rst
CODE:
```
.. bibliography:: _static/references.bib
   :cited:
```
